intro: Dasystephana grossheimii, commonly known as the Cape chestnut, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces edible fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
